Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Class AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI extends TwoWayCI>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentInterface, OfferedCI, RequiredCI, TwoWayCI, InboundPortI, OutboundPortI, PortI, TwoWayPortI<TWI>, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDataTwoWayPort, PingPongTwoWayPort
    public abstract class AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI extends TwoWayCI>
extends AbstractInboundPort
implements TwoWayPortI<TWI>
    The class AbstractTwoWayPort partially implements a two-way port for components calling each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.

    Description

    As components connected in a two-way peer-to-peer relationship where both can call each others using the same methods, the two-way port is modeled upon the inbound ports that admit multiple clients connected to them.

    Invariant

     invariant      !connected() || (getServerPortURI() != null)
 invariant      !connected() || (getClientPortURI() != null)
 invariant      !connected() == (getConnector() == null)
 invariant      !connected() || (getPortURI().equals(getClientPortURI()) || getPortURI().equals(getServerPortURI()))
 invariant      !connected() || (getOut() != null)
 invariant      !isRemotelyConnected() || connected()
 invariant      !isRemotelyConnected() || isDistributedlyPublished()

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

      connect the port where the owner is calling its port to initiate the connection.
      void doDisconnection()
      disconnect the port where the owner is calling its port to initiate the disconnection.
      java.lang.String getClientPortURI()
      return the URI of the client port in the connection enabled by this port.
      AbstractTwoWayConnector<TWI> getConnector()
      returns the connector to which this port is attached, and null if none.
      java.lang.Class<? extends TwoWayCI> getImplementedInterface()
      return the interface implemented by this port on behalf of the component.
      TWI getOut()
      returns the proxy to be used by the owner component when calling components connected to this port.
      java.lang.String getServerPortURI()
      return the URI of the server port in the connection enabled by this port.
      boolean isRemotelyConnected()
      when connected, return true if the connection is remote and false otherwise.
      void obeyConnection​(java.lang.String otherPortURI, ConnectorI connector)
      connect this port, knowing that the other port initiated the connection and that in the connection protocol of two way ports, the initiator will always be considered as the requiring/client side and the other side the offering/server (to be compatible with the connection protocol of plain outbound and inbound ports.
      void obeyConnection​(java.lang.String otherPortURI, java.lang.String ccname)
      connect this port, knowing that the other port initiated the connection and that in the connection protocol of two way ports, the initiator will always be considered as the requiring/client side and the other side the offering/server (to be compatible with the connection protocol of plain outbound and inbound ports.
      void obeyDisconnection()
      disconnect when the other component is the initiator of the disconnection.
      void setClientPortURI​(java.lang.String clientPortURI)
      sets the URI of the client port to which this port is connected.

      set the connector of the port, establishing the connection with a provider.

      sets the URI of the server port to which this port is connected.
      void unpublishPort()

      sets the URI of the client port to which this port is connected.

      unset the connector of the port, cutting the connection with a provider.

        create and initialise two-way ports, with a given URI.

        Contract

         pre    owner != null && uri != null
 pre    implementedInterface != null
 post   !isDestroyed()
 post   getPortURI().equals(uri)
 post   getOwner().equals(owner)
 post   !connected()
 post !isRemotelyConnected()
 post   owner.isPortExisting(uri)
 post   getImplementedInterface().equals(implementedInterface)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the port.
        implementedInterface - interface implemented by this port.
        owner - component that owns this port.
        pluginURI - URI of the plug-in to be called in the owner or null if none.
        executorServiceURI - URI of the executor service to be used to execute the service on the component or null if none.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • obeyConnection

        public void obeyConnection​(java.lang.String otherPortURI,
                           java.lang.String ccname)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        connect this port, knowing that the other port initiated the connection and that in the connection protocol of two way ports, the initiator will always be considered as the requiring/client side and the other side the offering/server (to be compatible with the connection protocol of plain outbound and inbound ports.
